intro: Asperugo vulgaris, commonly known as the common asperugo, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in umbels. The plant has finely divided, feathery leaves that are aromatic when crushed. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks. Asperugo vulgaris is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
